alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 12 at 7:38PM CDT until May 12 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MONONA...NORTHWESTERN HARRISON AND EASTERN BURT COUNTIES... At 737 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Tekamah, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Tekamah, Onawa, Blencoe, Turin, Lewis And Clark State Park, Kennebec and Pelican Point State Recreation Area. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
